name: The Majestic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a great place, can't wait to go back. Everything is so beautiful - the building itself, the rooms, the view from the porch, even the lobby area is outstanding. The room we had was large and came with two double beds, a gorgeous bathroom and a kitchenette. With the groupon package we had, upon arrival into the room, we were delighted to find a bottle of delicious champagne chilling in a bucket, cheese (including brie), crackers and fruit, and great soft music playing on the cd player.
reviews.title: Fantastic Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We took a cab to Langosta for dinner (we could have just walked there from the boardwalk if the weather had cooperated). The food was terrific and it had a great crowd - highly recommended. Then we just walked across the street from the restaurant and went to the Stone Pony to listen to a Bruce Springstein cover band - fun night.
reviews.title: Lovely...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The boardwalk and beach are steps away from the property (less than half a block). Perfect location.
reviews.title: Small Quaint Beach Town!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was pretty simple, but okay to start the day. The owners are very friendly and have lots of good restaurant suggestions. This really is a first class property and anyone lucky enough to experience it will always want to visit it again and again.
reviews.title: Great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010
reviews.text: As much travelling as I've done, I've never stayed in a bed and breakfast before. In addition, I've never visited Ocean Grove, NJ...which is ironic since I'm a Jerseyean who only lives a half hour away! Both new experiences were pleasantly surprising. The Majestic was warm and cozy...great service and the feeling of truly getting away without really "going away" was wonderful. Perfectly located...steps away from the beautiful beach and in the other direction a quaint little town with shops and little eateries (go to Nagles for any meal and especially the ice cream!). A short walk up the boardwalk, and you're in booming Asbury Park! Staying here, you can't lose. Will definitely be booking again...perhaps even a fall trip!
reviews.title: An Inn With Class and Charm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In short, you're paying for location. One block from a beautiful beach and the boardwalk. If, as we were, you're staying in November, it's not such a big benefit. The room was average size, in average shape, with average amenities. Breakfast was, you guessed it, average. Service was terrific. Everyone was very nice and extremely helpful. Would we stay again? Not at these prices.
reviews.title: Absolutely fine

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading mostly positive reviews, we booked a room for two nights in August. We chose the "older" rooms (based on the reservation clerk's advice since she suggested that they were larger than the newer rooms. We were not impressed.
reviews.title: Underwhelmed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our problems were all related to the maintenance (or lack thereof) of the room. Let me also preface this by stating that we were contacted by the Manager to offer a cash adjustment after our stay but after 6 weeks and numerous emails left unanswered, we assume he has withdrawn his offer.
reviews.title: Nice room, great dining room...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: The armoire in the room had no handle and we had to pry it open. Once we opened it, we could not close it and the door swung open. We finally jammed it shut and lived out of our suitcases since there was no other place for our clothes. The toilet "ran" the entire time we were there. Each time we used it, we had to lift the top and adjust the chain. The switchplate on the wall did not have a cover (so we did not use it) and the reading light mechanism came loose each time we tried to turn it on. There was a huge swatch of wallpaper border missing from the corner. There was no wand on the blinds so we were never able to let in light unless we lifted them up completely (and the view was exhaust fans and another building very close). You might wonder why we put up with all of this during our stay...we just wanted to use the room and did not want our access compromised by maintenance people servicing these many repairs. The rest of the rooms were booked so we could not switch rooms either.
reviews.title: Elegant and Comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: We assumed a boutique hotel would check these features prior to announcing that the room was ready.
reviews.title: Fortune 500 Company rates the Majestic experience as EXCEPTIONAL

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The accommodations were upscale. The staff was friendly and accommodating. Includes a nice restaurant for lunch and dinner (summer). we would definitely return.
reviews.title: nice ambiance

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Sadly, the general manager informed me that they do not want my money, even though the hotel is not completely booked, because they "do not have facilities" for underage children.
reviews.title: No KIDS allowed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not that we *need* any facilities besides the beach...?? We bring our own porta-crib for our very well-behaved 2 yr old. Sadly, we now have to stay outside of Ocean Grove and give our money to a CHAIN HOTEL even though we don't want to.
reviews.title: Definitely worth staying at the Majestic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were fortunate enough to have chosen to stay at the Majestic Hotel in July, 2009. Our experience was absolutley wonderful; the staff was more than accomodating and the restaurant in the hotel was excellent. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, especially to a couple looking to for a special place to spend quality time together.
reviews.title: Outstanding Inn And Off The Charts Service - Read This.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Majestic for our 5 year anniversary and can not say enough great things about our experience at the Majestic. So here's the scoop: beautiful accomodations... right near the water... quiet street... friendly staff... room was spanking new and very modern... inn is very charming... food was delicious... price was right. The cons? None. Room with a view? Check. Spacious porch to sit on on while staring at the ocean? Check. Friendly staff? Check. Oh - and how about this: I just called them up to say my sister and brother in law were staying there this weekend for their anniversary and I asked if they could do something special for them. They offered to send a bottle of wine and a wonderful dessert to their room. I said great, how much? The reply: it's on the house because you were kind enough to refer business to us. Get any better than that? Didn't think so. Call and book your next stay with them now.
reviews.title: A true Gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: This was my second stay at the Majestic - a year apart. Both times I was impressed by the high quality of the furnishings & the rooms. The personal yet unobtrusive service is a real pleasure to experience. The Majestic Hotel is within walking distance of the shore (you can hear the ocean if you open the windows !!!) & it is a real pleasure to stay there.
reviews.title: Boutique Hotel with excellent personal service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I will be back again & again !!!
reviews.title: An outstanding B & B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I spent a night as a get away from the house and kids. The room couldn't have been more beautiful and we had a great ocean view.
reviews.title: Perfect weekend beach getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Dinner downstairs was fantastic ( I highly recommend the lamb shank) and you can't beat the location.
reviews.title: This was a fantastic spot with fabulous service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: If you want to stay at the Jersey shore, The Majestic is the place to go.
reviews.title: Excellent Service & Setting at the Majectic Hotel, Ocean Grove, NJ

description: The Majestic! The premier Hotel in the historic town of Ocean Grove, NJ and among the top rated hotels along the NJ shoreline. Built in 1870, with additional sumptuous and spacious accommodations added in 2007; luxurious surroundings and a gracious staff offer a 5-Star experience delivered with a personal touch. At Bia, a European bistro, guests indulge in offerings elegantly crafted by our Executive Chef.
